question_text: Has the establishment made an electronic application for registration to the registering officer within sixty days from the date of applicability of this Code?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Registration Application
capture_instructions.document_name: Electronic Certificate of Registration or Application Receipt
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Certificate of Registration'. If pending, upload the 'Application Receipt' showing the date of submission.

gatekeeper.prompt: Analyze this image. Return 'OK' if it looks like a Government Registration Certificate, Application Receipt, or Form-1. Return 'REJECT' if it is blurry, irrelevant, or not a document.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract the 'Date of Application' or 'Date of Issue'. 2. Compare it with the 'Establishment Start Date' provided in metadata. 3. If the difference is > 60 days, mark status 'Delayed'. 4. If the document is missing or invalid, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 5. Otherwise, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Has the employer intimated the registering officer electronically within thirty days of any change in ownership, management, or other registration particulars?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Amendment Intimation
capture_instructions.instruction: If details (Ownership/Management) have changed, upload the 'Intimation Receipt' or 'Amended Certificate'. If no changes occurred, upload a 'Nil-Change Declaration' signed by HR.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a document showing an amendment to registration, or a signed declaration? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check if the document is a 'Nil Declaration'. If yes, mark 'Compliant'. 2. If it is an amendment receipt, extract the 'Date of Change' and 'Date of Intimation'. 3. If (Intimation Date - Change Date) > 30 days, mark 'Delayed'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: In the event of closing the establishment, did the employer inform the registering officer and certify payment of all dues to workers within thirty days?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Closure Intimation
capture_instructions.instruction: If the establishment is closed/closing, upload the 'Closure Intimation' sent to the officer. If active, upload a statement: 'Establishment Active - Not Applicable'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Closure Notice, Dues Certificate, or a 'Not Applicable' statement? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If text says 'Establishment Active' or similar, mark 'Compliant' (N/A). 2. If Closure Notice, check if 'Date of Intimation' is within 30 days of 'Date of Closure'. 3. Verify if 'Payment of Dues' is mentioned/certified. 4. If late or dues not certified, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Has the employer sent a notice of commencement of operation electronically prior to starting operations in a factory, mine, or construction work?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Notice of Commencement
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Notice of Commencement' submitted to the authorities. Ensure the acknowledgement stamp/date is visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a 'Notice of Commencement' or Form-IV? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Date of Submission' and 'Date of Commencement of Operations'. 2. If Submission Date is > Commencement Date, mark 'Non-Compliant' (Must be prior). 3. Otherwise, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Does the establishment possess a valid common license or single license if it operates as a factory, industrial premises for beedi/cigar, or engages contract labor?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Common/Single License
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the valid 'Common License' or 'Single License'. Check if it has expired. If renewed, upload the renewal application.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a License document (Factory/Contract Labour)? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract the 'Valid Upto' or 'Expiry Date'. 2. Compare with Today's Date. 3. If Expired, check for 'Renewal Application Date'. 4. If Expired and No Renewal, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 5. If Valid, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Has the employer issued an appointment letter to every employee with the prescribed information?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Sample Appointment Letters
capture_instructions.instruction: Select 3 random employees (1 new joinee, 1 senior). Upload their Appointment Letters ensuring the 'Employee Acknowledgement' signature is visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Appointment Letter or Employment Contract? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Scan for 'Wages', 'Designation', and 'Nature of Work'. 2. Scan for 'Signature of Employee' (Acknowledgement). 3. If basic terms or signature are missing in any of the 3 samples, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Does the employer provide free annual health examinations or tests to employees of the prescribed age or class?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Health Checkup Records
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Annual Health Checkup Report' summary or the Invoice from the Hospital/Lab showing payment by the Employer.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Medical Report, Health Checkup list, or Hospital Invoice? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract the 'Date of Examination'. 2. Ensure it is within the last 12 months. 3. Check if the 'Billed To' entity is the Employer (indicating free for employee). 4. If old or self-paid by employee, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Is the disposal of hazardous and toxic waste, including e-waste, ensured by the employer?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Waste Disposal Manifest
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the latest 'Hazardous Waste Manifest' (Form 10) or Certificate from the authorized disposal agency (TSDF).

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Waste Manifest, Disposal Certificate, or Agreement with a recycler? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for 'Authorized Agency' stamp or TSDF name. 2. Check the 'Date of Disposal' is recent (last 3-6 months). 3. If no authorized agency is linked, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Has the employer sent notice of any accident causing death or bodily injury preventing work for 48+ hours to the prescribed authorities?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Accident Notices
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Accident Notice' sent to authorities for any accident in the last year. If NO accidents occurred, upload the 'Accident Register' showing Nil entries.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Accident Notice (Form 12) or an Accident Register? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If document is a Register showing 'Nil' or 'No Accidents', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If it is an Accident Notice, check the 'Date of Accident' vs 'Date of Notice'. 3. If Notice Date > (Accident Date + 48 hours), mark 'Delayed'.

question_text: Has the employer sent notice of any dangerous occurrences to the prescribed authorities?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Dangerous Occurrence Notice
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload notice sent for events like fire/explosion/collapse. If NONE occurred, upload a signed 'Nil-Declaration' for the audit period.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Dangerous Occurrence Notice or a signed Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Notice exists, check submission timeline (typically 24-48 hours). 3. Mark 'Delayed' if submitted late.

question_text: Has the employer sent notice to authorities regarding any worker contracting a disease specified in the Third Schedule?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Disease Notification
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the notice sent to authorities for any Third Schedule disease (e.g., Silicosis, Lead poisoning). If none, upload a 'Nil-Disease Declaration' signed by the Medical Officer.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Disease Notification Form or a 'Nil Declaration'? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Notice exists, check 'Date of Diagnosis' vs 'Date of Notice'. 3. If Notice is sent > 7 days after diagnosis (or prescribed limit), mark 'Delayed'. 4. Check if the disease named is from the Third Schedule.

question_text: Has the employer ensured that articles used in the establishment are designed and constructed to be safe and without risk to health?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Safety Certificates
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Third-Party Safety Certification' or 'Design Test Report' for heavy machinery (e.g., Boilers, Lifts, Cranes).

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Technical Safety Certificate, Load Test Report, or Design Manual? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Scan for 'Pass', 'Safe for Use', or 'Conformity' status. 2. Check the date of the last test. If > 12 months (or prescribed period), mark 'Non-Compliant'. 3. If the report indicates 'Unsafe' or 'Repairs Needed', mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Did the employer take immediate remedial action upon being informed of an imminent danger by an employee?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Imminent Danger Action Report
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the report sent to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator regarding action taken on reported imminent dangers. If no such events, upload 'Nil-Incident Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Action Taken Report or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Report exists, check 'Date of Danger Report' vs 'Date of Action'. 3. If action was not 'Immediate' (same day or next day), mark 'Delayed'.

question_text: Has a Safety Committee been constituted with equal or greater representation of workers compared to employer representatives?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Safety Committee Minutes
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Order Constituting the Committee' or the latest 'Minutes of Meeting' listing all attendees.

gatekeeper.prompt: Does this document list names of committee members or attendees? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Identify the list of 'Management Representatives' and 'Worker Representatives'. 2. Count them. 3. Logic: If Worker_Count >= Management_Count, mark 'Compliant'. Else 'Non-Compliant'. 4. Check if the meeting date is recent (last 3 months).

question_text: Has the employer appointed the prescribed number of qualified Safety Officers?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Safety Officer Credentials
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Appointment Letter' AND the 'Degree/Diploma in Industrial Safety' for the appointed Safety Officer(s).

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Appointment Letter or an Educational Certificate/Degree? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check Appointment Letter for 'Safety Officer' designation. 2. Check Degree for 'Industrial Safety' or equivalent qualification. 3. If both exist and match the same person, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Does the employer afford all facilities for safety and occupational health surveys conducted by authorized officers?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Survey Acknowledgement
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Inspection Book' entry or 'Survey Report' signed by the Chief Inspector/DG. If no survey was conducted, upload 'Nil-Survey Statement'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Inspection Report, Survey log, or Nil Statement? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Statement', mark 'Compliant' (N/A). 2. If Report exists, scan for 'Non-cooperation' or 'Access denied' remarks. 3. If remarks are negative, mark 'Non-Compliant'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Does the establishment collect, compile, and analyze occupational safety and health statistics in the prescribed form?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Safety Statistics
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Annual Safety Statistics Return' filed with the government or the internal 'Safety Analysis Report'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Statistical Table, Data Chart, or Safety Report? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check if the document contains data tables (Accidents, Man-hours, Frequency Rate). 2. Check the 'Period' (Year/Month). 3. If data is present and period is current, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Is the establishment maintained in a state of cleanliness and hygiene?

inspection_steps: Walk through the entire production floor, corridors, and staircases.
Check for accumulation of dirt, cobwebs, oil spills, or overflowing waste bins.
Inspect if drains are open, clogged, or emitting foul odors.
Verify if 'Cleaning Schedule' is displayed and updated.

decision_criteria.compliant: Floors are clean, no accumulation of waste, drains are clear.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Visible dirt heaps, oil spills, blocked drains, or foul smell.

question_text: Are adequate ventilation, temperature, and humidity maintained in the workrooms?

inspection_steps: Enter the main workrooms and stay for 5 minutes.
Check if air circulation is sufficient (fans/blowers/AC working).
Observe if workers are sweating excessively or showing signs of heat stress.
Check the 'Temperature/Humidity Gauge' if installed (should be < 30°C typically).

decision_criteria.compliant: Comfortable temperature, good airflow, exhaust fans operational.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Stifling heat, suffocating atmosphere, or broken ventilation systems.

question_text: Is the work environment kept free from dust, noxious gas, fumes, and other impurities?

inspection_steps: Go near machines generating dust or fumes (e.g., Grinding, Welding, Chemical mixing).
Check if 'Local Exhaust Ventilation' (hoods/pipes) is installed and suction is working.
Visually check for dust clouds or haze in the air.
Smell for strong chemical odors.

decision_criteria.compliant: Air is clear, exhaust systems are running, no strong odors.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Visible dust clouds, strong fumes, or non-functional exhaust systems.

question_text: Is adequate potable drinking water provided at convenient points?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Water Potability Report
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the latest 'Drinking Water Potability Test Report' from an approved lab. Ensure the 'Date of Test' and 'Result' (Pass/Fail) are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Laboratory Test Report for Water Quality? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Date of Test'. Ensure it is within the last 12 months. 2. Look for the final conclusion: 'Fit for Drinking', 'Potable', or 'Conforms to IS:10500'. 3. If result is 'Fail' or 'Unsafe', mark 'Non-Compliant'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are adequate standards maintained to prevent overcrowding and provide sufficient space to employees?

inspection_steps: Enter the main production/work hall.
Observe if workers are bumping into each other or machinery while working.
Check if aisles and walkways are clear of obstructions.
Look for the 'Maximum Capacity' notice on the wall (if applicable).

decision_criteria.compliant: Sufficient space (approx 14.2 cubic meters/person), clear walkways, no congestion.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Workers are cramped, aisles are blocked, or space feels suffocating.

question_text: Is adequate lighting provided in every part of the establishment where workers are working or passing?

inspection_steps: Walk through corridors, staircases, and work areas.
Check if you can read small text (like an ID card) easily without straining eyes.
Look for flickering lights or dark corners.
Check if Emergency Exit lights are functional.

decision_criteria.compliant: Well-lit areas, no dark spots, no flickering lights.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Dim lighting causing eye strain, broken bulbs in corridors.

question_text: Are sufficient latrine and urinal accommodations provided separately for male, female, and transgender employees?

inspection_steps: Visit the restrooms.
Count the number of toilets vs approximate number of workers (Rule of thumb: 1 per 25 males/females).
Check for gender signage (Male/Female/Transgender) on doors.
Check for privacy (doors with latches) and water availability.

decision_criteria.compliant: Separate, marked facilities available, clean, water running, doors lockable.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Common toilet for all, broken doors, no water, or foul hygiene.

question_text: Are effective arrangements made for the treatment of wastes and effluents?

capture_instructions.title: Upload PCB Consent Order
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Consent to Operate' (Air/Water) from the Pollution Control Board. Check if the 'Validity Date' is current.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Pollution Control Board Consent Order? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Valid Upto' date. 2. Compare with Today's Date. 3. If Expired, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 4. If Valid, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are adequate and suitable washing facilities provided separately for male and female employees?

inspection_steps: Inspect the washing area (washbasins/taps).
Check if there are separate areas or screened sections for men and women.
Verify if soap and running water are available.

decision_criteria.compliant: Separate facilities, clean, running water, soap provided.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: No separation (mixed use), no water, or taps broken.

question_text: Are separate bathing places and locker rooms provided for male, female, and transgender employees?

inspection_steps: Ask if the facility requires bathing (e.g., hazardous process, mines).
If yes, inspect the locker/bathing rooms.
Check for separation of genders and security of lockers.

decision_criteria.non_compliant: Mixed usage, no lockers where required, or dirty condition.

question_text: Are sitting arrangements provided for all employees who are obliged to work in a standing position?

inspection_steps: Identify workers who stand all day (e.g., assembly line, machine operators).
Look for chairs, stools, or benches nearby for them to rest occasionally.
Ask a worker: 'Are you allowed to sit when not working?'

decision_criteria.non_compliant: No chairs visible, workers forced to stand continuously.

question_text: Is a canteen facility provided in the establishment where one hundred or more workers are ordinarily employed?

inspection_steps: Check worker count. If <100, mark Compliant (N/A).
If >100, visit the canteen.
Check if food is being served, seating is adequate, and the kitchen looks hygienic.
Check if the Price List is displayed.

decision_criteria.compliant: Canteen exists, is operational, and clean.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: No canteen despite >100 workers, or canteen is non-functional/unhygienic.

question_text: Are adequate first-aid boxes or cupboards with contents readily accessible during all working hours?

inspection_steps: Locate the First-Aid box on the floor.
Open it. Check if it contains basic items (bandages, antiseptic, cotton, burnol).
Check expiry dates on one or two medicines.
Ensure the box is NOT locked or the key is immediately available.

decision_criteria.compliant: Box accessible, contents fully stocked and not expired.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Box empty, locked with no key, or medicines expired.

question_text: Is an ambulance room provided where more than five hundred workers are ordinarily employed?

inspection_steps: Check total worker count. If <500, mark Compliant (N/A).
If >500, inspect the Ambulance Room.
Verify if a nurse or medical assistant is present.
Check if the room has a bed, stretcher, and oxygen cylinder.

decision_criteria.compliant: Room exists, is staffed, and equipped.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: No room, room used for storage, or no medical staff available.

question_text: Are separate shelters or rest-rooms and lunch-rooms provided for male, female, and transgender employees where required?

inspection_steps: Check worker count (>50).
Visit the Rest Room / Lunch Room.
Verify if it is well-ventilated, lit, and clean.
Check for gender separation (different rooms or partitioned areas).

decision_criteria.compliant: Clean, separate rooms available for dining/resting.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Workers eating on production floor, dirty rooms, or no separation.

question_text: Has a Welfare Officer been appointed where two hundred and fifty or more workers are ordinarily employed?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Welfare Officer Docs
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Appointment Letter' of the Welfare Officer AND their 'Degree/Diploma in Social Science/Labour Welfare'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Appointment Letter or University Degree? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check Appointment Letter for 'Welfare Officer' title. 2. Check Degree for 'Labour Welfare' or 'Social Work'. 3. If both match the same person, mark 'Compliant'. If missing or unqualified, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Is a crèche facility provided where more than fifty workers are ordinarily employed?

inspection_steps: Check worker count (>50).
Visit the Crèche (or ask for the agreement with a nearby common crèche).
If on-site: Check if it is clean, has toys/beds, and is safe for kids.
If off-site: Verify the distance is reasonable.

decision_criteria.compliant: Facility exists, looks safe and hygienic.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: No facility provided despite having >50 workers.

question_text: Is the daily working limit of eight hours strictly adhered to for all workers?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Attendance Register
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Attendance Register' for the last month. Ensure 'In-Time' and 'Out-Time' columns are clearly visible for a random sample of workers.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Attendance Register with Time-In/Time-Out columns? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Pick 5 random rows. 2. Calculate (OutTime - InTime) - RestInterval. 3. If Result > 8 hours (or 9 including rest) WITHOUT overtime marking, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 4. If all are <= 8 hours, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are wages paid at twice the ordinary rate for any overtime work performed?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Overtime Wage Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: Find a worker who did Overtime last month. Upload their 'Wage Slip' showing the 'OT Rate' or 'OT Amount' calculation.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Wage Slip or Payroll Sheet showing Overtime? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Basic Wage Rate' (A). 2. Extract 'Overtime Rate' (B). 3. Calculate Ratio = B / A. 4. If Ratio >= 2.0, mark 'Compliant'. 5. If Ratio < 2.0 or OT paid as 'Single Rate', mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Is the consent of the worker obtained prior to requiring them to work overtime?

capture_instructions.title: Upload OT Consent Form
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a sample 'Overtime Consent Form' signed by a worker, or a digital log showing worker acceptance of OT.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a signed Consent Form or Digital Approval Log? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Scan for 'Consent', 'Agree', or 'Willingness'. 2. Check for Employee Signature/Digital ID. 3. If signed and dated, mark 'Compliant'. If blank or missing, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Is the Notice of Periods of Work displayed correctly and maintained at the establishment?

inspection_steps: Go to the Notice Board near the main entrance.
Look for 'Form-A' or 'Notice of Periods of Work'.
Check if it shows Start Time, End Time, Rest Intervals, and Shift Groups.
Verify it is in English and the Local Language.

decision_criteria.compliant: Notice is displayed, filled out, and readable.

question_text: Are changes to the system of work intimated to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator before implementation?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Shift Change Intimation
capture_instructions.instruction: If shift timings changed recently, upload the 'Intimation Letter' sent to the Inspector. If no changes, upload 'Nil-Change Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Letter to the Inspector or a Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Letter exists, compare 'Date of Letter' with 'Date of Shift Change' (from context/letter). 3. If Letter Date < Change Date (Prior Intimation), mark 'Compliant'. Else 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Is the system of shifts arranged to ensure no overlapping relays of workers doing the same kind of work?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Shift Roster
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Shift Roster' showing timings for Shift A, B, and C. Ensure overlap times (if any) are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Shift Roster or Time Table? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Identify Stop Time of Shift A and Start Time of Shift B. 2. If Shift B starts BEFORE Shift A ends (Overlap), check if they do the same work. 3. If Overlap exists without specific Exemption Order, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Are measures in place to prevent double employment of workers who have worked in another factory/mine within the preceding 12 hours?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Double Employment Declaration
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a sample 'Declaration Form' signed by a new joiner stating they are not working elsewhere. If not available, upload the 'Appointment Letter' clause forbidding dual employment.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a signed Declaration or Employment Contract clause? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for text 'Dual Employment' or 'Double Employment' or 'Working elsewhere'. 2. Verify if the worker certifies they have not worked in the preceding 12 hours. 3. If clause exists and is signed, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Is every worker allowed a weekly holiday, ensuring they do not work for more than six days in any one week?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Weekly Holiday Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Attendance Register' for the previous month. Ensure 'Sundays' or 'Rest Days' (marked as 'W' or 'H') are clearly visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Attendance Register showing a full month? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Select 3 random workers. 2. Scan their attendance row. 3. Check for any sequence of 'Present' (P) > 6 days without a 'Holiday' (H) or 'Week Off' (W). 4. If > 6 consecutive work days found, mark 'Non-Compliant'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are compensatory holidays granted within two months to workers deprived of any weekly holiday due to exemptions?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Comp-Off Register
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Compensatory Holiday Register'. If no workers worked on holidays, upload 'Nil-Work on Holiday Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Compensatory Holiday Register or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Register: Find a 'Work on Holiday' date (Date A). 3. Find the corresponding 'Compensatory Off' date (Date B). 4. Calculate Days = Date B - Date A. 5. If Days > 60, mark 'Delayed'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are workers who have worked 180 days or more in a calendar year granted annual leave with wages at the prescribed rate?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Annual Leave Record
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Leave with Wages Register' for the last calendar year. Show the columns for 'Days Worked' and 'Leave Credited'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Leave Register showing Days Worked and Leave Balance? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Identify a worker with 'Days Worked' >= 180. 2. Calculate Expected Leave = Days Worked / 20. 3. Compare with 'Leave Credited'. 4. If Credited < Expected, mark 'Non-Compliant'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Is the carry-forward of unavailed annual leave compliant with the maximum limit of thirty days?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Leave Carry Forward Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Year-End Leave Register showing 'Closing Balance' and 'Carried Forward' columns.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Leave Register showing Closing Balances? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Scan 'Carried Forward' column. 2. If any value > 30, check for 'Refused Leave' note. 3. If > 30 AND no 'Refused' note, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 4. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are wages in lieu of unavailed leave paid within the prescribed timeline upon discharge, dismissal, quitting, or superannuation?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Full & Final Settlement
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Full & Final Settlement' (F&F) receipt for an employee who left recently. Ensure 'Leave Encashment' and 'Date of Payment' are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Full & Final Settlement document? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Date of Exit' and 'Date of Payment'. 2. Calculate Gap. 3. If Gap > 2 days (for quitting) or > 2 months (for death/retirement), mark 'Delayed'. 4. Verify 'Leave Encashment' amount > 0. Else 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Is the worker entitled to encash leave that exceeds the thirty-day carry-forward limit?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Leave Encashment Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload proof of payment for 'Leave Encashment' for workers with >30 days leave balance at year end.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Payment Record for Leave Encashment? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check if document shows 'Encashment' or 'Payment in lieu of leave'. 2. If valid payment record exists for excess days, mark 'Compliant'. If excess days lapsed/expired without pay, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Does the employer maintain a register electronically or otherwise containing prescribed particulars of workers?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Worker Register
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the master 'Register of Workers' (Muster Roll). Ensure details like Name, Designation, and Date of Joining are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Muster Roll or Register of Workers? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for columns: 'Name', 'Nature of Work', 'Wages', 'Date of Employment'. 2. If all key columns are present and filled, mark 'Compliant'. If blank or missing columns, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Are notices displayed at the workplace in the prescribed manner and form?

inspection_steps: Go to the main Notice Board.
Check for: 1. Abstract of the Act. 2. Wage Rates. 3. Name/Address of Inspector. 4. Holiday List.
Verify they are in English and Local Language.
Check if they are torn or faded.

decision_criteria.compliant: All required notices displayed, readable, and bilingual.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Notice board empty, missing key abstracts, or only in English.

question_text: Are wage slips issued to workers in electronic forms or otherwise?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Wage Slip Sample
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a 'Wage Slip' issued to a worker for the last month. Ensure 'Deductions' and 'Net Pay' are clear.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Wage Slip or Salary Slip? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for fields: 'Name', 'Days Worked', 'Gross Wages', 'Deductions' (PF/ESI), 'Net Pay'. 2. If all fields are legible, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Has the employer filed the return electronically or otherwise to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator within the prescribed period?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Annual Return
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Unified Annual Return' filed for the previous financial year. Ensure the 'Acknowledgement Receipt' with the date is attached.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Annual Return Form or Filing Receipt? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Filing Date' from the receipt. 2. Compare with the Due Date (typically Feb 1st or as per state rules in context). 3. If Filed Date > Due Date, mark 'Delayed'. 4. If Filed Date <= Due Date, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Does the contractor inform the principal employer electronically of wage amounts paid to contract labor?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Contractor Wage Intimation
capture_instructions.document_name: Email / Portal Log of Wage Payment
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a screenshot of the Email or Portal Notification sent by the Contractor to HR confirming wage disbursement for the last month.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Email, Letter, or Screenshot regarding wage payment? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for details: 'Amount Paid', 'Number of Workers', 'Month'. 2. Check if the recipient is the Principal Employer. 3. If intimation exists and is clear, mark 'Compliant'. Else 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Is an experience certificate issued to contract labor on demand?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Experience Certificate
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a copy of an 'Experience/Service Certificate' issued to a contract worker who left recently. If none left, upload a blank template used by the contractor.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Experience Certificate or Service Letter? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for fields: 'Name of Worker', 'Period of Work', 'Nature of Work'. 2. If it is a filled certificate, mark 'Compliant'. 3. If it is a template, mark 'Compliant' (Process exists).

question_text: Has the employer obtained consent from women employees before employing them between 7 p.m. and 6 a.m.?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Night Shift Consent
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Written Consent Form' signed by a female employee working night shifts. If NO women work night shifts, upload a 'Nil-Night Shift Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Consent Form or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration' or 'Day Shift Only', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Consent Form: Check for 'Signature' and 'Date'. 3. Check if date of consent is BEFORE the shift dates. 4. If valid, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are adequate safeguards provided prior to the employment of women in operations considered dangerous?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Safety Safeguard Report
capture_instructions.instruction: If women work in dangerous operations (as notified), upload the 'Risk Assessment Report' or 'Safety Audit' outlining safeguards. If N/A, upload 'Not Applicable' statement.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Safety Report, Risk Assessment, or N/A Statement? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'N/A', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Report: Scan for specific safeguards for women (e.g., prohibited chemicals, PPE). 3. If safeguards are listed, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Is the prohibition on employing persons below eighteen years of age in mines strictly enforced?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Age Proof (Sample)
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload Age Proof (Aadhaar/10th Certificate) for the 2 youngest looking workers found on site.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Identity Card or Age Proof document? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Date of Birth' (DOB). 2. Calculate Age = Today - DOB. 3. If Age < 18, mark 'Non-Compliant' (Critical Violation). 4. If Age >= 18, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are apprentices and trainees between 16 and 18 years of age working in mines under proper supervision?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Trainee Supervision Order
capture_instructions.instruction: If trainees (16-18 yrs) are employed, upload the 'Approval Letter from Chief Inspector'. If none, upload 'Nil-Trainee Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Approval Letter or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Letter: Check for 'Chief Inspector' approval stamp. 3. If valid approval exists, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Has a Certificate of Fitness been obtained from a medical officer for every adolescent employed in factories, plantations, or motor transport undertakings?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Adolescent Fitness Cert
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Certificate of Fitness' for any adolescent (14-18 yrs) worker. If no adolescents employed, upload 'Nil-Adolescent Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Medical Fitness Certificate or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Certificate: Check 'Date of Issue' (Valid for 1 year). 3. If expired, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 4. Check for 'Fit for Work' statement.

question_text: Does the contractor hold a valid licence issued by the designated authority for supplying or engaging contract labour?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Contractor License
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Labour License' of the main contractor. Ensure the 'Max Number of Workers' and 'Validity' are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Contract Labour License? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Expiry Date'. If < Today, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 2. Extract 'Max Workers Permitted'. Compare with 'Actual Workers' (from metadata/context). 3. If Actual > Permitted, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 4. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Is the engagement of contract labour restricted to non-core activities, unless specifically permitted?

inspection_steps: Ask the Plant Manager: 'What is the main product/activity here?' (e.g., Making Cars).
Observe the Contract Workers. Are they making the cars (Core)? Or are they Cleaning/Security/Loading (Non-Core)?
If Contract workers are doing the EXACT same job as permanent workers, mark Non-Compliant.

decision_criteria.compliant: Contract workers engaged in support services (Cleaning, Canteen, Security, Loading).
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Contract workers performing core manufacturing/production tasks.

question_text: Does the principal employer ensure that welfare facilities are provided to contract labour employed in the establishment?

inspection_steps: Go to the common facilities (Canteen, Restrooms, Drinking Water).
Observe if Contract Workers are using them.
Ask a contract worker: 'Are you allowed to use the canteen and toilets here?'
Check if there are any 'Staff Only' signs restricting contract workers.

decision_criteria.compliant: Contract workers have equal access to all welfare amenities.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Contract workers are denied access or forced to use inferior separate facilities.

question_text: Are wages paid to contract labour via bank transfer or electronic mode before the expiry of the prescribed period?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Contractor Wage Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Bank Advice / Transaction Log' from the Contractor showing wage disbursement to workers for the last month.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Bank Statement or Transaction Log? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Date of Transaction'. 2. Check if it is before the 7th (or prescribed day) of the following month. 3. If Date > Due Date, mark 'Delayed'. 4. If document shows Cash Payment without exemption order, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Has the principal employer paid the wages in full or the unpaid balance if the contractor failed to do so?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Default Payment Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: If a contractor defaulted on wages, upload proof of 'Direct Payment' by Principal Employer. If no default occurred, upload 'Nil-Default Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Payment Record or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Payment Record: Verify payer is 'Principal Employer'. 3. Mark 'Compliant' if payment was made to resolve contractor default.

question_text: Has the contractor intimated the designated authority upon receiving a work order?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Work Order Intimation
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Intimation Form' submitted by the Contractor to the Labor Department for the current Work Order.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Government Intimation Form? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Date of Intimation' and 'Start Date of Contract'. 2. If Intimation Date > Start Date, mark 'Delayed'. 3. If missing, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Has the principal employer ensured they are not employing contract labour through a non-licensed contractor?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Vendor Compliance List
capture_instructions.document_name: Vendor Master List with License Details
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Active Contractor List' showing Name, License Number, and Validity Date for each.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Vendor List or Contractor Matrix? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Scan the list. 2. If any contractor has 'License No' as Empty/Null or 'Validity' < Today, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 3. If all have valid, unexpired licenses, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Does the employer pay a lump sum journey allowance to every inter-State migrant worker annually for travel to and from their native place?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Journey Allowance Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload proof of 'Journey Allowance' payment to migrant workers. If no migrant workers, upload 'Nil-Migrant Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Payment Voucher or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Payment Voucher: Check narration for 'Journey Allowance' or 'Travel Fare'. 3. Verify amount is reasonable (>0). 4. If paid annually, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are inter-State migrant workers extended all benefits available to other workers, including ESIC, PF, and medical check-ups?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Migrant Benefit Proof
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the PF/ESIC ECR (Electronic Challan Return) highlighting names of Migrant Workers.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a PF/ESIC Challan or ECR list? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Scan for worker names (from context if available). 2. Check if contributions exist for them. 3. If migrant workers are found in the list with contributions, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: In case of fatal accident or serious bodily injury to a migrant worker, are reports sent to the specified authorities of both States and the next of kin?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Migrant Accident Report
capture_instructions.instruction: If a migrant worker had a serious accident, upload the report sent to Home State & Host State authorities. If none, upload 'Nil-Accident Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Accident Report or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Report: Check if it addresses 'Home State Authority' AND 'Host State Authority'. 3. If sent to both, mark 'Compliant'. If sent to only one, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Does the employer ensure suitable conditions of work for inter-State migrant workers?

inspection_steps: If Migrant Workers reside on-site, inspect their quarters.
Check for basic amenities: Electricity, Water, Bedding, Ventilation.
Check if safety instructions are available in their local language.
Interview one worker: 'Do you face any discrimination here?'

decision_criteria.compliant: Quarters are humane/clean, language support provided.
decision_criteria.non_compliant: Sub-standard living conditions, no language support.

question_text: Has the occupier disclosed all prescribed information regarding dangers and health hazards to workers, the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator, the local authority, and the general public?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Hazard Disclosure
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload 1. The 'Disclosure Form' submitted to the Chief Inspector. 2. A photo of the 'Public Notice' displayed near the factory gate warning of hazards.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Disclosure Form or Public Notice photo? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check Document 1 for 'Receiving Stamp' from Chief Inspector. 2. Check Document 2 (Photo) for 'Hazard Warning' text visible to public. 3. If both exist, mark 'Compliant'. If missing, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Has the occupier laid down a detailed health and safety policy and intimated it to the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator and local authority?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Health & Safety Policy
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Health & Safety Policy' signed by the Occupier. Ensure the 'Date of Signing' and 'Acknowledgement Receipt' from the Inspector are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Health & Safety Policy document? Return 'OK' if readable.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for 'Signature of Occupier'. 2. Check for 'Date' (should be reviewed annually). 3. Check for evidence of submission (Stamp/Receipt) to Chief Inspector. 4. If signed and submitted, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Has an on-site emergency plan and detailed disaster control measures been drawn up and approved?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Emergency Plan
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the cover page and approval page of the 'On-Site Emergency Plan'. Ensure the 'Approval Signature' from the Chief Inspector is visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Emergency Plan or Disaster Control document? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Scan for 'Approved by Chief Inspector' stamp or letter. 2. Check the 'Date of Approval'. 3. If approval is missing or outdated (>5 years typically, or as per state rules), mark 'Non-Compliant'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are accurate and up-to-date health/medical records maintained for workers exposed to harmful substances?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Health Register Sample
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Health Register' (Form 17) for a worker exposed to chemicals. Ensure recent medical entries are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Health Register or Medical Record Form? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for 'Date of Examination' in the last 6-12 months. 2. Check for 'Signature of Factory Medical Officer'. 3. If entries are recent and signed, mark 'Compliant'. If blank or old, mark 'Non-Compliant'.

question_text: Has the occupier appointed qualified and competent persons to supervise the handling of hazardous substances?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Supervisor Qualifications
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Appointment Letter' of the Hazardous Process Supervisor AND their 'Competency Certificate' or 'Training Certificate'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Appointment Letter or Training Certificate? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Check for 'Supervisor' designation. 2. Check for specific training in 'Hazardous Chemicals' or 'Safety'. 3. If qualified person appointed, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Is medical examination provided to every worker before assignment to a hazardous job and at intervals not exceeding twelve months?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Medical Fitness Schedule
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the 'Medical Examination Schedule' showing the list of workers and their last exam dates.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this a Medical Exam Schedule or List? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Last Exam Date' for 3 random workers. 2. Calculate Gap = Today - Last Exam Date. 3. If Gap > 12 months for any worker, mark 'Non-Compliant'. Else 'Compliant'.

question_text: Are the permissible limits of exposure to chemical and toxic substances strictly adhered to?

capture_instructions.title: Upload Industrial Hygiene Report
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the latest 'Industrial Hygiene / Air Monitoring Report'. Ensure 'Measured Value' and 'Permissible Limit' columns are visible.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Air Monitoring or Hygiene Report? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. Extract 'Measured Value' and 'Permissible Exposure Limit' (PEL/TLV). 2. Compare. If Measured > PEL, mark 'Non-Compliant'. 3. If Measured <= PEL, mark 'Compliant'.

question_text: Has the occupier informed the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator about the nature and details of any new hazardous process within 30 days before commencement?

capture_instructions.title: Upload New Process Intimation
capture_instructions.instruction: If a NEW hazardous process started recently, upload the 'Intimation Letter' sent to the Inspector 30 days prior. If no new process, upload 'Nil-New Process Declaration'.

gatekeeper.prompt: Is this an Intimation Letter or Nil Declaration? Return 'OK'.

evaluator.prompt: 1. If 'Nil Declaration', mark 'Compliant'. 2. If Letter: Extract 'Date of Letter' and 'Date of Process Start'. 3. If (Process Start - Letter Date) < 30 days, mark 'Delayed' or 'Non-Compliant'. Else 'Compliant'.
